results.title: Spiceworld: the movie
results.creator_credit: Fragile Films, Uri Fruchtmann, Barnaby Thompson and Bob Spiers
results.brief_description: A thriller with a little romance and a lot of comedy, “Spiceworld” chronicles the five crazy days leading to the Spice Girls’ first live concert at the Royal Albert Hall. Photojournalists follow as they travel from press conferences to practice sessions to photo shoots, passing London landmarks in the comfort of their tardis Spicebus and emerging into a musical cascade of colour, trendy clothes and blinding flashbulbs. Exploring the trials and tribulations of their global fame, “Spiceworld” takes a satirical stab at the media giants and commercial junkies who relentlessly compete to manufacture the girls’ success or demise. Cast includes The Spice Girls, Richard E. Grant, Alan Cumming, George Wendt, Claire Rushbrook and Roger Moore.

results.title: Spellbound
results.creator_credit: David O. Selznick and Alfred Hitchcock
results.brief_description: Ingrid Bergman plays Dr. Peterson, a detached and brilliant psychiatrist who falls helplessly in love with Dr. Edwards, played by Gregory Peck, only to find he is an amnesiac and imposter suspected of murdering the true Dr. Edwards.

constellations_other.name: Good vibrations
constellations_other.description: Since its invention, the humble theremin has been used in a number of different ways to evoke all sorts of strange sounds and moods.

results.description: Ingrid Bergman plays Dr. Peterson, a detached and brilliant psychiatrist who falls helplessly in love with Dr. Edwards, played by Gregory Peck, only to find he is an amnesiac and imposter suspected of murdering the true Dr. Edwards. She sets out to prove his innocence, becoming a fugitive herself. Through skilful detective work, she manages to access the dark and confused chambers of his mind finding the clues which help her unravel this perplexing mystery.

results.title: Speedy
results.creator_credit: Harold Lloyd Corporation and Ted Wilde
results.brief_description: Harold Lloyd’s last silent work and the only one shot entirely on location in New York, tells of Harold ‘Speedy’ Swift’s efforts to save the last horse-drawn streetcar line in New York from the machinations of some traction magnates. He has to surmount all sorts of obstacles to do so including getting ‘Babe’ Ruth to his baseball on time. The end-of-an-era plot line must have partly reflected Lloyd’s feelings towards the introduction of sound to the movies. With an orchestral score performed by The Live Cinema Orchestra. Cast also includes Ann Christy and Burt Woodruffe.

results.title: Speedway
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Douglas Laurence and Norman Taurog
results.brief_description: All Steve Grayson (Elvis Presley) wants to do is drive cars and win. The only problem is his gambling manager has lost his money on the horses and drawn the attention of the IRS as well as a $145,000 debt. Fortunately for Steve the IRS manifests itself in leggy agent Susan Jacks (Nancy Sinatra). All is not lost on the financial front either, as Steve gets some valuable driving tips from former driver Abel Esterlake (William Schallert), which may help him win back the money in the Charlotte 500, and keep himself and his manager out of jail. Features the following songs: “Speedway”, “Let yourself go”, “There aint nothing like a song”, and Nancy Sinatra singing “Your groovy self”. Contains the original theatrical trailer. Cast also includes Gale Gordon, Bill Bixby and Carl Ballantine.

results.title: Speed (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Mark Gordon and Jan De Bont
results.brief_description: Fast moving, action packed and relentless, ‘Speed’ transports the viewer into a world gone mad, as a terrorist “mad bomber” (Dennis Hopper) holds a bus load of innocent passengers to ransom. Keanu Reeves is a SWAT specialist who must ensure that the bus keeps speeding through the streets of Los Angeles at no less than 50mph if the passengers are to stay alive. Co-starring Sandra Bullock and Jeff Daniels.

results.title: Space cowboys
results.creator_credit: Mad Chance, Clint Eastwood, Clipsal Films, Village Roadshow Pictures and Malpaso Company
results.brief_description: In the 1950s, a US test pilot team, codenamed Team Daedalus, have been training to become the first Americans in space. They are passed over by NASA who decide to send a chimp instead. Over the years, Frank Corvin (Clint Eastwood), Hawk Hawkins (Tommy Lee Jones), Jerry O’Neill (Donald Sutherland) and Tank Sullivan (James Garner) have been forgotten and move onto other professions - Corvin becomes an aerospace engineer, Hawkins, a freelance pilot, Sullivan, a Baptist minister, and O’Neill, an astrophysicist who designs roller coasters in his free time. The four all live a quiet life until NASA learns that a Russian satellite will crash into earth, causing a major communication blackout, unless a failure in the satellite’s system can be repaired. When NASA discovers that the satellite’s system is identical to one Corvin designed, they ask him for help. He agrees, but only if he can do the repairs himself and that the original Team Daedalus can come along as his crew. ‘Space cowboys’ was produced and directed by Clint Eastwood. Cast also includes James Cromwell, Marcia Gay Harden, Courtney B. Vance, Loren Dean and William Devane.

results.title: Soylent green
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Walter Seltzer, Russell Thacher and Richard Fleischer
results.brief_description: The year is 2022. New York City is teeming with a writhing mass of 40 million citizens, most of whom are unemployed. Strawberry jam costs $150.00 a jar and voluntary death is encouraged by Government Clinics. Food as we know it is very scarce and the people rely on a biscuit-like foodstuff called Soylent. Detective Thorn (Charlton Heston) is a harried cop investigating the death of a rich magnate (Joseph Cotten) in the dictatorial Soylent company. Edward G. Robinson, in his final screen role plays an aged and wise researcher who remembers what the earth was like with trees, vegetables and democracy. As the threads of the murder unravel, Heston finds himself face to face with the hideous truth about Soylent. Displaying an intensity of poetic and visual invention, this provocative film is a nightmarish vision of a world slowly choking itself to death. Based upon the novel by Harry Harrison.

results.title: Southern comfort
results.creator_credit: Phoenix Films, EMI/Parlophone, Cinema Group, David Giler and Walter Hill
results.brief_description: Louisiana 1973 - a squad from the Louisiana National Guard, together for a weekend reconnaissance exercise in the Louisiana Bayou, are about to experience the fight of their lives against an unexpected enemy. Eight men make up the squad and within this group exists a volatility which is about to tear them apart. Their own private unintentional war begins when they decide to steal three canoes from a Cajun campsite. This action results in unfortunate consequences when trigger-happy Private Stuckey fires blanks at some local Cajuns who have spotted them paddling off in the canoes. Retaliation and revenge follows and the battle for survival begins. Filmed in the Louisiana swamps, director Walter Hill (Crossroads, 48 Hours, Last man standing) has succeeded in creating an atmospheric environ which heightens the tension and adds to the ever-increasing state of paranoia. Surreal and disturbing, “Southern comfort” bears a similarity to “Deliverance” where the environment and the local people become the focus of the story. As in “Deliverance”, music too plays an important part and it is the brilliant Ry Cooder who has composed and arranged the music for this film with cinematography by Andrew Laszlo. Cast includes Keith Carradine, Powers Boothe, Fred Ward, Peter Coyote, Carlos Brown.

results.title: South Park: bigger, longer & uncut [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Paramount Pictures, Trey Parker and Matt Stone
results.brief_description: The boys from the American cult television program South Park launched onto the big screen in 1999 with their first feature length film ‘Bigger Longer and Uncut’, a cleverly written musical film looking at censorship and the influence film and television has on child development. Created by Trey Parker and Matt Stone, South Park follows the misadventures of friends Stan Marsh, Kyle Broflovski, Kenny McCormick and Eric Cartman in a small town called South Park in Colorado. Alien abductions, giant Barbra Streisand monsters and poor Kenny being killed episode after episode are just a few things the foul-mouthed boys have to deal with. When the boys see an R film starring Canadian icons ‘Terrance and Philip’, their parents become distressed at the language the boys are using. Rather than take responsibility for not supervising their children, the parents choose to blame Canada, and arrest Terrance and Philip, causing an USA v Canada war. With Terrance and Philip’s lives at stake, the boys create an underground children’s resistance, aptly named ‘La Resistance’ to free their Canadian idols before they are executed. The films subplot explores relationships, including Stan’s unusual relationship with classmate Wendy Testeburger, and her new found affection for a boy who is ‘political’. South Park character favourites Mr Garrison, Mr Mackey, Chef and Officer Barbrady also make appearance, as does Saddam Hussein, Satan and Winona Ryder. Parker and Stone’s clever soundtrack, spoofing a number of popular musicals including ‘Les Miserables’ and ‘The Sound of Music’ in addition to their own musical creations, earned them an Oscar nomination for Best Song (“Blame Canada’) in 2000. Features the voices of Isaac Hayes, Minnie Driver, Eric Idle and George Clooney. Warning: CONTAINS COARSE LANGUAGE.
